Summary.introduction: Greetings! I'm Dr. Hackman, a computer science enthusiast with an insatiable curiosity for data science. I obtained my Ph.D. degree from National Chiao Tung University, where I also completed a one-year postdoc fellowship. For both my Ph.D. and fellowship, I was supervised by Prof. Vincent S. Tseng. Prior to this, I earned my master's in computer science from Yuan Ze University and my bachelor's in computer science from The University of The Gambia. My Ph.D. dissertation is titled A Study on Trend Analysis in High Utility Itemset Mining. My research interests include data mining, machine learning, medical AI, deep learning, generative AI, and data analytics. Currently, my research is focused on the medical field, aligning with my current job position. In this role, I aim to develop medical AI models that can make a positive impact on the healthcare sector.

Projects.title: Automatic Segmentation of Membranous Glottal Gap Area with U-Net-based Architecture
Projects.description: Videostroboscopy is a widely used method for investigating vocal fold function. However, evaluating numerical values, such as the membranous glottal gap area, is time-consuming for clinical application. We enrolled 137 patients and collected 2507 videostroboscopy images. We developed five U-Net-based deep-learning models for automatically masking the membranous glottal gap area.
contribution: Developed a user-friendly interface for medical AI applications.
Performed the ETL for the project.
Trained all deep learning models for the project.
Implemented FastAPI for integration into the hospital's health information system.
Drafted and wrote over 50% of the research manuscript.
Projects.outcome: The best model's I0U score is 0.8503. We integrated the model into the hospital to improve patient care. Our manuscript was accepted for publication.
Projects.challenges: One of the main challenges is that the segmentation output has a condition we referred to as broken edges in some cases. To address this problem, we developed an edge-filling algorithm.

Projects.title: Funduscopic Image Analysis
Projects.description: The Funduscopic Image Analysis project aims to conduct a comprehensive examination of funduscopic images, establishing a robust correlation between the status of the fundus and various systemic diseases. Funduscopic images provide valuable insights into the eye's interior, particularly the retina and optic nerve, serving as a non-invasive diagnostic tool for systemic health assessment. Leveraging advanced medical AI techniques, the project extracts meaningful patterns and relationships from funduscopic images, contributing to early disease detection and personalized patient care.
contribution: Developed a user-friendly interface for medical AI applications.
Designed the strategy for model training.
Implemented deep learning methods for funduscopic image analysis.
Drafted and wrote over 70% of the research manuscript.
Projects.outcome: Currently, we have achieved a model accuracy of 91%, and our manuscript is nearing completion for submission.
Projects.challenges: As the sole technical member on the team, overcoming challenges included learning and adapting to new technologies and tools.

Projects.title: Large Language Model for ICD Coding
Projects.description: Automation of ICD (International Classification of Diseases) code prediction from medical records. This project aims to fine-tune open-source large language models for predicting ICD codes from medical records. The current manual process of assigning ICD codes to diseases is error-prone and subject to human interpretation.
contribution: Data cleaning and preprocessing.
Developed strategies for fine-tuning the models.
User interface development for ICD coding.
Drafted and wrote over 98% of the research manuscript.
Projects.outcome: The project has produced an open-source ICD coder, poised to significantly reduce coding time, with my ongoing commitment to optimize its use.
Projects.challenges: Managing the dataset presented a significant challenge, necessitating innovative strategies for information extraction and model-friendly representation.

Projects.title: Skin Lesion Detection and Classification
Projects.description: Utilizing over three thousand images from the EHR system of Changhua Christian Hospital, our goal is to develop a model for detecting skin lesions and classifying them into distinct categories.
contribution: Prepared the dataset for training.
Conducted model training for classification.
Developed the user interface for the model.
Projects.outcome: Our initial accuracy on the binary classification task reached 92%, and we are actively working on enhancing the model's performance while expanding the number of classes.
Projects.challenges: Several artifacts in the dataset require removal. Our initial approach involved using cropping to mitigate artifacts, and we aim to explore alternative approaches in future iterations.

Projects.title: Detection of LVI from WSI using Deep Learning Methods
Projects.description: The application of deep learning in pathology for identifying Lymphovascular Invasion (LVI) is well-studied. However, at our hospital, we are developing a deep learning model to identify LVI and implementing a report generator to alleviate the workload of pathologists.
contribution: Data cleaning and preprocessing.
Model building and training.
User interface development for LVI detection.
Projects.outcome: Our developed platform can identify the presence of LVI in WSI images with 95% accuracy. Currently, we are integrating the model inference into a report generation framework.
Projects.challenges: The size of each Whole Slide Image is significantly large; therefore, we implemented a slicing strategy to process each image.

Projects.title: No-Code Low-Code AutoML Platform for Medical AI Applications
Projects.description: This project aims to create a user-friendly platform that medical professionals can use without any coding requirements. Domain experts in data science can also leverage this application to build their own models.
contribution: Designed the project architecture.
Developed the user management module.
Built the MVP of the Low-code Module.
Implemented the CSV data import module.
Implemented the CSV data cleaning module.
Projects.outcome: The current outcomes include the CSV data cleaning module, and the low-code module is currently under development.
Projects.challenges: The main challenge in this project is the limited manpower availability. We are actively seeking solutions to address this issue once the funding is secured.

Projects.title: Denial of Service Attack Detection
Projects.description: Identifying and mitigating distributed denial-of-service attacks using deep learning methods.
contribution: Designed and built a simulator for the project.
Performed ETL for parameter selection.
Projects.outcome: Provided a parameter list for more efficient model development, achieving an accuracy of over 90% in the initial phase.
Projects.challenges: The primary challenge in this project was working with an unfinished hardware device. To address this, we developed a simulator to generate data based on open-source dataset specifications, such as the CIC-IDS2017 dataset, and the specifications of the hardware device.

Projects.title: Diagnoses of Multiple Sclerosis Using Deep Learning Methods
Projects.description: Developed a model for classifying multiple sclerosis patients.
contribution: Performed the ETL for the project.
Built different models for comparison.
Projects.outcome: Developed five models for comparison, with our best model achieving over 82% accuracy.
Projects.challenges: While the project had a flexible timeline, being the sole member working on it required me to invest extended hours in the lab to ensure task completion.

Projects.title: Survey of Continual Learning Frameworks
Projects.description: Conducted a thorough preliminary study to explore and understand continual learning frameworks in preparation for a collaborative project. Regrettably, despite our efforts, the project was not awarded to my lab. The study aimed to lay the groundwork for potential collaboration, assessing the landscape of continual learning methodologies and their applications in various domains.
contribution: Surveyed numerous papers on continual learning.
Tabulated and documented the surveyed materials.
Projects.outcome: Although the collaborative project did not materialize, the extensive survey provided invaluable insights into the diverse landscape of continual learning frameworks and their potential applications across various disciplines. This experience enhanced my knowledge and understanding of the evolving field.
Projects.challenges: The primary challenge encountered during this project was the vast amount of materials to survey. Navigating through numerous papers and synthesizing relevant information demanded meticulous attention to detail and a comprehensive understanding of the subject matter.

Projects.title: Trend Analysis in Utility Pattern Mining
Projects.description: Expand and significantly contribute to the utility pattern mining research.

contribution: Surveyed and tabulated many utility pattern mining publications
proposed and designed mining algorithms.
Implemented mining algorithm in both java and python programming languages.
Drafted and published academic papers in international conferences.
Projects.outcome: We proposed applications of utility pattern mining by introducing the following itemsets; Trending High Utility Itemsets. Emerging High Utility Itemsets. Stable High Utility Itemsets. We published three academic papers in international conferences.
Projects.challenges: Published research work in the area of high utility itemset mining has very excellent algorithms that are already archiving excellent results. To manage this challenge and make better contribution, we proposed applications for variations of the HUIM problem.
